diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute appendicitis with microperforation and phlegmon collection; Peripheral mesenteric vein thrombophlebitis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with worsening right lower quadrant pain, subjective fevers, tender abdominal examination findings, and imaging showing a distended appendix with extensive fat stranding and loculated fluid collections, indicative of acute appendicitis with perforation. Additionally, CT imaging revealed a filling defect in a mesenteric vein suggesting thrombophlebitis.
